Posts.Content: mizz wrote: Evening everyone - I am starting chemo next week and have started looking around for a wig I don't want to spend a fortune but would like something for when I feel that I don't want to wear a scarf or hat.  Can anyone suggest a reasonably priced / reasonably good looking and quite trendy wig - I'm 34.  Would welcome any advice.  Dx 4/1/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/8 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: wigs and hair loss mizz mizz

Posts.Content: May 24, 2008 06:19PM mizz wrote: thanks for all your ideas and suggestions.  I understand how you feel Otter as before posting this I had already bought what I now realise is a bad wig - the wig lady was convinced that it was the correct length/colour and style for me and I suppose I just trusted her but I got it home and hated it!! Gona look on line and see if there is something more me.

Posts.Content: mizz wrote: Hi All, I am just wondering if other people experience much bone pain during chemo - I find that my hips are particularly painful just after treatment and seem to ache all of the time.  I have had 5 doses of fec so far with 1 more to go.  I suppose I am worried about the pain in my hip in case it is something more sinister and would be grateful to know if this is something that troubles others... I have mentioned this to my oncologist and he has not suggested a bone scan or anything so guess he is not concerned..  I would appreciate any comments.. best wishes to all Dx 4/1/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/8 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: hip pain and fec chemo mizz IrishTwin
